fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Suppose that f,g\colon A\rightrightarrows \Omega '. We need to show that f = g. To this end, it suffices to show \top f = \top g since \top is monic.

Consider the subobject classified by \top f. Note that by the pasting lemma, this subobject is isomorphic to f^{*}(\top ^{*}(\top )) in \mathsf {Sub}(A). Since \top is monic, \top ^{*}(\top ) is an isomorphism. Then since isomorphisms are stable under pullback, the subobject classified by \top f is an isomorphism. Thus, (\top f)^{*}(\top ) \cong \mathsf {id}_{A} in \mathsf {Sub}(A). Analogously, we have (\top g)^{*}(\top ) \cong \mathsf {id}_{A} in \mathsf {Sub}(A), so we can conclude that \top f and \top g classify isomorphic subobjects.

fr:title.text: Domain of the generic subobject is terminal

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Domain of the generic subobject is terminal

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let \top \colon \Omega '\to \Omega be the generic subobject of a category \mathcal {C} with pullbacks, then \Omega ' is terminal.
